text: sent: thursday, june 29, 2000 3:51 am from: bo passer (bpasser@calweb.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: ellison the slimethe article on oracle's involvement in the "trash buying incident" ("'twas oracle that spied on ms," june 28, 2000) just reinforces my belief in the slime factor of both ellison and gates. both of these men think they are above the law or any semblance of fair play. at least gates has been more open than ellison. ellison points out all the conspiracies he believes microsoft has with groups, but isn't it convenient how he ignores his own associations?at least gate's company has led the software revolution. oracle is a great database, but that's all it is.the only reason ellison wants microsoft broken up is so he can have a bigger piece of the pie. please don't be foolish enough to believe he has any thoughts at all for the consumer. if he did, he'd be using half of his wealth to help consumers. he'd be cutting prices to his software. there are all sorts of things he can do, but he just keeps raking the money in. poor little billionaire.
